#summary Setup development environment
#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation
= Introduction =

This is a small guide on how to set up the development environment.


= Steps =

  # Install [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ Eclipse].
  # Check out trunk with subversion.
    * You can do this from Eclipse using the [http://subclipse.tigris.org/install.html Subversive plugin].
    * Or you can use [http://subversion.tigris.org/links.html#clients Any other SVN client].
  # Install [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/ Google Web Toolkit]
  # Create a {{{lib}}} directory in the checkout.
  # Download and add the following jars to the {{{lib}}} directory:
    * From [http://www.springsource.com/download/community?project=Spring%20Framework spring-framework-2.5.6-with-dependencies] add:
      * {{{spring-beans.jar}}}
      * {{{spring-core.jar}}} 
      * {{{spring-jdbc.jar}}} 
      * {{{spring-tx.jar}}} 
      * {{{commons-logging.jar}}} 
    * From [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/ Google Web Toolkit] add:
      * {{{gwt-servlet.jar}}} 
      * {{{gwt-user.jar}}} 
    * From [http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=15494 JFreeChart v1.0.11] add:
      * {{{jfreechart-1.0.11.jar}}} 
      * {{{jcommon-1.0.14.jar}}} 
  # Download [http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/5.1.html MySQL Connector/J 5.1] and add {{{mysql-connector-java-5.1.X-bin.jar}}} to {{{jre/lib/etc}}} folder of your JDK.
  # Eclipse project and classpath files are checked in as well. You can use these and modify to fit your needs.
  # Install mysql and create a user named stegusr with password stegpw and with permissions on the spelstegen schema.
  # To create the tables in mysql execute the following command from a prompt:
     * {{{mysql -u stegusr -p < generated_create_tables.sql}}}
  # Run {{{MainApplication.launch}}} from Eclipse to start the application in Google Web Toolikt browser. You will have to change the path to {{{gwt-dev-windows.jar}}} under the classpath tab in the launch configuration to match your location.
  # You can also build the project with Ant. The target for deployment is build.war.
